com.livelife.motolibrary

Class AntData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.livelife.motolibrary.AntData

  • public class AntData
extends java.lang.Object
    AntData contains all the constants and methods used to configure the MOTO tile look and behaviour.
    Author:
    Max Leggieri - DTU Playware

    • Constructor Detail

      • AntData

        public AntData(byte targetId)
        The main constructor, initialize also the ANT payload.
        Parameters:
        targetId - the MOTO tile id (1-10)

    • Method Detail

      • allColors

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> allColors()

      • getPayload

        public byte[] getPayload()
        Returns:
        The current ANT message data

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Set the AntData to a specific color
        Parameters:
        color - The color constant, possible values are: LED_COLOR_OFF, LED_COLOR_RED, LED_COLOR_BLUE, LED_COLOR_GREEN, LED_COLOR_INDIGO, LED_COLOR_ORANGE, LED_COLOR_WHITE, LED_COLOR_VIOLET

      • setColor

        public void setBroadcastData(byte[] data)
        Set directly the data to transmit
        Parameters:
        data - the 8 bytes ANT message

        public void setColorCountdown(int color,
                              int speed)

      • setInit

        public void setInit()

      • setIdle

        public void setIdle(int color)
        Set the MOTO tile to an idle state, the tile will not send any PRESS/RELEASE event

      • setSetup

        public void setSetup(byte scanId)
        Set the MOTO tile to a setup state where in case of a PRESS event the tile will store the internal id to the value specified by the scanId parameter.
        Parameters:
        scanId - The new tile ID to be stored

      • setBlink

        public void setBlink(int numBlink,
                     int color)
